children.subject: I took CS 189 last semester and am taking Stat 151A this semester and enjoy it. It is a more applied class, but helps a lot with everything in the ML pipeline. The class focuses on EDA and analyzing the model after solving for the weights (ie hypothesis test on weights and prediction CI), so it feels like a good successor to 189. I hear Stat 150 is mostly taken since it is helpful for quant interviews, but not very useful as a class after 126.

I've taken Stat 151A, eecs126 (kind of like stat 150), cs189, and work in a lab at BAIR. I would say that if you are thinking of taking on more courseload to prepare for ML (as opposed to trading tech for tech), then don't. The best think you an do to prepare for ML is to do any coding project available cause the limiting factor will be code quality and bugginess, not your understanding of ML.
Stat 150 is mostly useless for ML imo

history.content: I'm interested in taking some stats classes recently, especially after taking cs189 and really enjoying it. I've seen that people recommend STAT 150, 151A and 153 for those into quant. However, are these courses useful in general? for someone interested in stat & ml and not necessarily quant? Are these classes considered "foundational" statistics you need to understand stuff in stats or ml research? I've taken eecs126 btw but haven't taken anything from the STAT dept yet.
history.subject: Are STATS 150, 151A or 153 useful for CS/ML?
